item.title: "Forking" a Github Repo Without Forking It
item.description: This is also known as “mirroring” a repository. Step by step process Open your terminal. Create a bare clone of the repo in your local machine. git clone --bare https://github.com/username/old-repo-name.git Notice the --bare parameter. Go to the newly cloned directory. cd old-repo-name Mirror-push to the new repository[^before doing this make sure that you’ve already created the new repository on GitHub]. git push --mirror https://github.com/username/new-repo-name.git Remove the local repository created earlier.
